channel.title: Projects on Calvin Schwickerath
channel.description: Recent content in Projects on Calvin Schwickerath

item.title: Autochroot
item.description:
Autochroot is an old project I made in either 2021 or 2022 that automatically makes a chroot environment with the selected binaries and their dependencies (using ldd)
It probably shouldn’t be used. There were many problems, like /proc, /sys and other directories not showing up. I had (and still have) very little knowledge on chroots.

GitHub: CalSch/autochroot

item.title: Confetti
item.description:
It’s a C++ program that makes confetti pop up on your screen. I don’t have a video of it because I’m lazy.

GitHub: CalSch/confetti

item.title: Graphing Calculator
item.description:
I made a graphing calculator in C++ using raylib and tinyexpr++

It has a grid with labels, colors, variables, and basic saving and loading, but it leaves lots to be desired, like a color picker, polar graphs, points, implicit equations, variable sliders, and custom functions.

GitHub: CalSch/graphing

item.title: Tiny Tron
item.description:
This is a Commodore 64 Tron port I made for Hackclub Say Cheese, a challenge where you have to make a program that fits into a QR code.

To play, you load the file as a disk into a Commodore 64 (or an emulator) and press space to start. Player 1 starts on the left and uses WASD to move, and player 2 starts on the right and uses IJKL to move. When someone loses, the game over screen shows who won and what the score is.
